titles.title: Live Horseracing Protection Act of 2002
To amend the Interstate Horseracing Act of 1978 to require the consent of certain horsemen's groups for interstate off-track wagers, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committee.name: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

bill.summary: 5/9/2002--Introduced. Live Horseracing Protection Act of 2002 - Amends the Interstate Horseracing Act of 1978 to rename"horsemen's group" as "host horseman's group," distinguishing it from "off-track horsemen's group," a breed-specific group representing the majority of owners and trainers in an off-track State that corresponds to the breed of horse in the races subject to the interstate off-track wager on any racing day.Includes "off-track horsemen's group" among those whose consent is required for acceptance of interstate off-track wagers by an off-track betting system.
